p: Either 10 mL of AECR (0.1 g extract/mL distilled water) or CECR (from section 2.3 above) was added to a beaker containing aqueous solution of gold (III) chloride trihydrate (190 mL, 1 mM) on a hot plate at 50 °C, and the reaction was continuously stirred for 10 min using a magnetic stirrer. The resultant nanoparticles were centrifuged twice at 15,000 x g for 15 min, after each washing with distilled water, to remove unbound and excess plant materials in the mixture. The pellet was thereafter left overnight at room temperature to air dry and kept at 4 °C until further use.
